titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Society for Psychophysiological Research records, ca. 1955-1987
titlestmt.author: Processed by UCLA Library Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: ©2002 The Regents of the University of California. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-10-06T10:37-0700. Supplementary encoding and revision by Caroline Cubé using Notetab Pro.

did.abstract: The Society for Psychophysiological Research was created to foster research related to physiology and psychology. The collection consists of correspondence, minutes, programs, publications, slides, and miscellaneous printed materials related to the Society for Psychophysiological Research.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

daodesc.p: Selected digitized images from this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of correspondence, minutes, programs, publications, slides, and miscellaneous printed materials related to the Society for Psychophysiological Research. Includes copies of the Polygraph Newsletter and the Psychophysiology Newsletter. Also includes oral history interviews (tapes and transcripts) with charter members of the organization.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The Society for Psychophysiological Research was created to foster research related to physiology and psychology. The organization produces scientific literature and holds annual meetings for presentations and discussion of topics such as instrumentation, methodology, experimental results, and theoretical interpretations.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Society for Psychophysiological Research Records (Collection 1194). UCLA Library of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact UCLA Library Special Collections for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.
